cause_of_action: Inadvertent omission of Roger Giles as an inventor during corporate restructuring
procedure_followed: Micromass applied to the Federal Court under Section 52 for an order to add Roger Giles as an inventor. The Commissioner took no position.
decision_reasoning: Section 52 of the Patent Act allows the Federal Court to order changes to Patent Office records, including correcting inventorship errors if they were inadvertent.
result_of_case: The application was granted, and Roger Giles was added as an inventor without costs.

residency_requirement: 1,095 days of residence in Canada within the four years preceding their application
application_details: appellant accumulated only 357 days of residence in Canada during the required period while studying abroad
decision_reasoning: failure to meet the statutory residency requirement due to prolonged absence from Canada for study
procedure_followed: Appeal heard by Federal Court Trial Division; citizenship judge’s decision reviewed and upheld
result_of_case: Appeal dismissed; appellant must fulfill residency requirement before reapplying

cause_of_action: Dispute over election results and interpretation of appeal timelines under the Election Regulations.
application_details: The applicants argued the appeal period should start after the run-off election.
decision_reasoning: Each election (general or run-off) is distinct, and the appeal period applies to the specific election being challenged. Evidence also showed no legitimate expectation was created by the electoral officer to delay appeals.
procedure_followed: Judicial review application filed by unsuccessful candidates challenging the electoral officer's decision not to appoint an Election Appeal Commission.
result_of_case: Application dismissed; appeal period determined to begin after the general election.
